abstract: Edward J. Ludwig, head of Becton, Dickinson, spoke about his company’s product line and its acquisition of GeneOhm Sciences last year.
snippet: Edward J. Ludwig, head of Becton, Dickinson, spoke about his company’s product line and its acquisition of GeneOhm Sciences last year.
lead_paragraph: Becton, Dickinson & Company may well be the most invisible of the nation’s publicly traded medical device giants. Its revenue, which topped $5.7 billion last year, comes from the sale of syringes, diagnostic kits, lab equipment and related gear widely used at home and overseas in doctors offices and hospitals.

headline.main: Medical Gear That Rarely Makes News
headline.print_headline: Medical Gear That Rarely Makes News
